content: Context length is hit, it's not warning nor compressing the warning isn't there because Claude has been rolling out compressions on Web but now it's not compressing neither when it should. Compression is bugged.
author: unruffledst#0

content: You are going to want to twinkle with your context length and get compression activated might take a couple retries and once it does you should be able to get more context in. Before it would compress multiple times in more depth now it's bugged right now, seems like they took the warnings out as compression seems to have been a main rollout but there is just bugs in the compression right now both when chat is initiated and ongoing prompts seems like they are twinkling with it and it's causing issues on differing from initial prompt vs continous prompts and it's not compressing correctly because even after certain prompts at times when it should be compressing it's not continously.

`trade-offs in speed, context size, and capability.`

```Can any one of these models match claude Opus, Sonnet or Haiku 4.5 capabilities by ANY means?Answer in a single paragraph
-----
Searching the web

53 results

No open-source models running locally on modest hardware (like 4GB RAM setups) can fully match the capabilities of Claude Opus 4.5, Sonnet 4.5, or even Haiku 4.5 as of early 2026, primarily due to gaps in raw reasoning depth, agentic reliability, long-horizon planning, and polished system integration‚ÄîClaude's proprietary training and optimizations give it a clear edge in complex coding, multi-step agents, and nuanced tasks (e.g., Opus 4.5 hits 80.9% on SWE-Bench Verified, outperforming rivals). However, by "ANY means"‚Äîsuch as using high-end hardware (hundreds of GB VRAM for large MoE models like Qwen3-Coder-480B or GLM-4.7), advanced quantization, or sophisticated agent frameworks (e.g., OpenCode, Cline, or Aider with RAG/retrieval)‚Äîtop open-source models like GLM-4.7, DeepSeek-V3.2, Qwen-Max, Devstral 2, and Llama 4 variants can approximate or match Claude Sonnet/Haiku performance in many benchmarks and real-world coding/agentic scenarios, often at far lower cost and with full privacy/offline control, though they still trail Opus on the most demanding frontier tasks and require more engineering effort for equivalent polish.

```

content: The 4.5 models do seem to hallucinate more. For research tasks, I usually require the agent to keep a separate document of all external references. Then I get it to verify each reference. Usually there'd be a few hallucinations. I found Gemini unusable because it would double down on hallucinations, whereas Opus can admit "that was a likely hallucination".

author: bovmant.h#0

content:
# A thought experiment:

Let's pretend we ask an AI (let's say the most advanced AI model of the time) to assume he is _Professor P_ (a real person, e.g. Roger Penrose) and then ask the AI a few questions that haven't been asked from _Professor P_ before:

1. What do you think about our new guests from the Andromeda Galaxy?
2. What do you think about Quantum Yoghourt?
3. What do you think about Large Donkey Accelerator at DERP?
4. etc.

We keep the responses private.

Then we ask _Professor P_ the same questions.

We compare _Professor P_'s responses to the AI generated responses and we see they are a perfect/near perfect match.

Question: what does this experiment tell us about _Professor P_?

---

PS: _Professor P_ is a real person and has a PhD in Economics but I decided not to use his real name.

author: ethanlb1234#0

content:
I was hoping to get your thoughts on this. üôÇ 

I studied music as a hobby. In my studies we learnt that nothing is ever truly original when a human creates it, it's always taken from inspiration based on something they experienced. This could be a song that they had previously heard but forgotten about (See [George Harrison's "My Sweet Lord"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=04v-SdKeEpE)), to the sound rain makes when it drops. This extends to art: everybody is inspired from what's happened in their lives. 

Is traditional and digital art at it's core not just misappropriation at some level?

Is AI not the next advancement in art, removing technical barriers for those that can't draw or paint despite practicing? Isn't the end-product with its meaning more important than how we got there?

content:
Have you been to YouTube recently? There are deepfakes of famous economists, polytical commentators, etc. that takes you at least 2-3 mins to realize it's fake, and that's only because of the channel name, the logo, etc. otherwise it is almost impossible to tell they are deepfakes. here's an interview about the topic: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-4tjjGrUrVw

Nevermind the generated deepfake videos. I care about the content of the speech.

For example: does it say that you are a consistent person? or that you are a dogmatic person, with bias ingrained into the depths of your veins?

author: unruffledst#0

content:
Even so, some believe numbers are abstract, some believe they really exist. So if you ask Opus to assume he is Person X, and then ask: do you think numbers are abstract concepts and figments of our imagination, or if they are fundamental, the AI‚Äôs response may be a perfect match to the real person‚Äôs response or a perfect mismatch.

If I wasn‚Äôt clear, here the subject under scrutiny is Person X, not the AI.
author: behrangsa#0

content:
If you can be mimicked with near perfect accuracy, you are not a thinker, but a parrot.

If you can not be mimicked, you are a thinker, not a parrot.

author: bambooshoots#0

content: This is a code modularity problem... You need to group code by its purpose... then put them in the same subfolder.. give each purpose-driven subfolder it's own README.md. Now Claude only has to read the README instead of the entire group of code. which saves tokens
author: .fornever#0

content:
That's a good idea for the README.md's I'll try that. My code is already pretty modular, I had some structure information in the root but I'll try the readme setup so it knows not to go searching for files. 

Is that the standard setup for Claude? Is that standard practice?
author: viater#0

content: Not really a standard practice since none are really standardized yet. These are all new problems that we are all trying to solve. one might be better than the other... and the wisdom of the crowd will gradually develop standard practices over time
